subtasks: Drive the tractor to the field and survey the soil conditions
Load the planter attachment onto the tractor
Align the planter with the row markers or guidewires

Check for any clogged seed hoppers or misaligned seed plates
Adjust the planter settings for uneven soil conditions
Conduct regular walking tours of the planted field to check seed emergence
Sort seeds by variety and maturity group
Weigh each bag or container to record the exact quantity
Store seeds in a cool, dry, and dark location to preserve germination rates
Label seed storage containers with variety name, planting date, and lot number
Monitor temperature and humidity levels in the storage area
Remove any damaged or old seeds and replace them if needed
Transfer seeds to appropriate bins or silos based on their planting schedule
Transport farm produce by loading it into a truck or trailer
Package items such as vegetables, fruits, or honey into retail-friendly containers
Set up a stall or booth at the event location

Assist in setup and teardown activities at the event, such as arranging displays and cleanup
Collect feed from the storage shed and transport it to the livestock area
Distribute feed to the animals, ensuring each receives the right amount and type
Check the freshness of the feed and discard any spoiled or moldy material
Clean feeders and watering troughs regularly to prevent disease transmission
Observe animals for signs of illness or abnormal behavior
Document feed consumption and health observations in the farm log
Examine animals for visible injuries, lumps, or skin conditions
Take temperature and weight measurements for monitoring health and growth
Administer vaccinations or medications as per the veterinarian’s recommendations
Check for proper alignment of feet and legs, adjusting shoes if necessary
S-interact with veterinarian or farm vet to discuss health concerns
Update medical records for each animal

tasks.task: Prune and maintain trees and shrubs
subtasks: Wear protective clothing and tools, such as gloves and pruners
Identify the appropriate pruning time for each orchard or ornamental plant
Remove dead or diseased branches to improve plant health
Thin overcrowded limbs to encourage better air circulation and sunlight penetration
Shape the tree’s structure for easier harvesting and reduced disease risk
Apply pruning cuts flush with the trunk or branch collar to prevent decay
Choose the correct pesticide type and application method for the pest problem

Wear protective clothing and respiratory gear when mixing or applying chemicals
Apply fertilizers according to soil test results and crop needs
Irrigate the fields to ensure adequate water supply, considering weather conditions
Monitor for signs of over-fertilization or pesticide drift
Keep records of all applications for future reference and compliance

tasks.task: Drive a four-wheeler to transport equipment

Drive to the destination at a safe speed, avoiding obstacles and following traffic signs
Securely attach the equipment upon arrival

Connect the grain tank and set up cleaning fans
Test the operation of the combine, adjust cutting height and speed
Enter the combine and set up proper driver position

Start the combine and begin harvesting
Monitor grain moisture, adjust shaker speed or auger impeller as needed
Check grain flow and grain leg accessibility, addressing any issues promptly
Attach the milking machine to the cow, ensuring proper teat cup positioning
Turn on the milking machine and monitor the vacuum level
Collect the milk sample for quality testing
Once milking is complete, disconnect and clean the teats and equipment
Record milking time, milk volume, and any observed issues in the dairy log
Monitor dairy cattle for health issues, such as mastitis signs
Restrain the pig humanely before transporting to the slaughter area
Ensure the pig is properly stunned before bleeding it
Use a sharp knife to perform a clean cut between the third and fourth ribs
Rebleed the animal if necessary and skin it promptly to prevent spoilage
Remove all organs, clean the meat by washing, and chill it rapidly
Package the meat according to regulations and store it at appropriate temperatures
Identify the location of the leak in the pipe
Shut off the water supply to the affected area
Dig around the pipeline to expose the area of leakage
Apply a patch or replace the damaged section of the pipe
Reconnect the pipe, ensuring a tight seal
Test the repaired section for leaks by observing or using a pressure test
Refill the irrigation system with water and check for proper function
Choose the appropriate cover crop seed based on soil needs and rotation plans
Prepare seed before planting, such as treating with a fungicide or cover or mixing with a carrier
Set up the seeder with the correct depth and spacing settings
Align the seeder with the rows or contour lines
Start the seeder and monitor planting for straight rows and even seed distribution

Collect organic materials such as manure, crop residues, and vegetable scraps

Layer the materials in a compost bin, alternating greens and browns
Maintain proper moisture levels and aeration by turning the pile periodically
Monitor temperature, checking for optimal decomposition (typically 55-65°C)

Store the finished compost and apply it to fields or gardens as needed
